it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Common.Network

Interface RMIConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RMIServer

    public interface RMIConnection
extends java.rmi.Remote
    RMI connection interface. The method here presented can be invoched remotely by the client and represent all the functionality offered by the remote RMIServer
    See Also:
    RMIServer

             throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        void sendMessage(java.util.UUID id,
                 java.lang.String Message)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        allows to send a message to the server
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the player who sent the message
        Message - the message which must be sent to the server. According to client network architecture, all messages sent by the client are string (generally
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getMessage

        java.lang.String getMessage(java.util.UUID id)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        allows to retrive messages from the server

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • hadMessage

        boolean hadMessage(java.util.UUID id)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        tells if there are messages for the client
        Returns:
        true if the server has sent a message to the client which must be get, false otherwise
        Throws:
